document_data.name: Sting Ray
document_data.mainbody: '''Sting rays''', also known as '''stingrays''', were a relatively common mundane species of aquatic animal in the ray family. They were cousins of the much larger [[manta ray]].
document_data.Description: The bodies of these creatures generally grew to be {{SI|3|ft|long=yes}} across and weigh roughly {{SI|25|lbs|k}}. Their tails were similarly {{SI|3|ft|long=yes}} and had one or more barbs near their base.
document_data.Behavior: Like other species of ray, this creature tended to hide its body beneath the silt and sand of the seafloor so they could surprise their prey. They could be irritable, but were rather lethargic.{{Cite dragon/200/Familiar Faces|33}}
document_data.Biology: These creatures possessed a wide-angled vision. The barbed tails that gave sting rays their name contained a powerful, painful venom that induced nausea and a temporary state of paralysis.
document_data.Combat: When threatened, such as being accidentally stepped on, sting rays would lash out at the offending creature with their barbed tails and injected them with its [[stingray poison|poison]].

Ecology.Diet: Sting rays were a [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bottom_feeder bottom feeding] species of aquatic animal. Like all species of ray, pungi rays were carnivorous creatures. They primarily fed upon mollusks and crustaceans.

Ecology.Relationships:
Some [[druid]]s that frequented aquatic environments were known to have sting rays as an [[animal companion]]. And some [[sea mage]]s were known to keep them as [[familiar]]s.

Some [[nereid]]s were known to keep sting rays as pets.
Ecology.Usage: The tails of these creatures could be fashioned into a form of [[whip]]. Other creatures were known to harvest their venom to use as poison.

document_data.Trivia: * Those who specialized in sea-based [[magic]] could [[summon]] a sting ray with the [[spell]] ''[[monster summoning II]]''.{{Cite dragon/220/Arcane Lore: Sea Magic|72}}
